00020 #ifndef CCN_SyncTreeWorker
00021 #define CCN_SyncTreeWorker
00022 
00023 #include "SyncHashCache.h"
00024 
00025 struct SyncNameAccum;
00026 
00027 /**
00028  * SyncTreeWorker maintains the state for walking a local sync tree root,
00029  * This is important becase the state cannot be simply kept in a call stack.
00030  */
00031 
00032 enum SyncTreeWorkerState {
00033     SyncTreeWorkerState_init,
00034     SyncTreeWorkerState_needFetch,
00035     SyncTreeWorkerState_fetching,
00036     SyncTreeWorkerState_error
00037 };
00038 
00039 struct SyncTreeWorkerHead {
00040     struct SyncHashCacheHead *cache;
00041     enum SyncTreeWorkerState state;
00042     intmax_t visits;
00043     int level;
00044     int lim;
00045     struct SyncTreeWorkerEntry *stack;
00046 };
00047 
00048 struct SyncTreeWorkerEntry {
00049     ssize_t pos;
00050     ssize_t count;
00051     struct SyncHashCacheEntry *cacheEntry;
00052 };
00053 
00054 
00055 /**
00056  * create a new tree worker, based on the given cache
00057  * ent != NULL: initialize from the given node
00058  * ent == NULL: create an empty worker, to be externally initialized
00059  * @returns the new worker
00060  */
00061 struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *
00062 SyncTreeWorkerCreate(struct SyncHashCacheHead *cache,
00063                      struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ent);
00064 
00065 /**
00066  * initialize an existing worker from the cache entry
00067  * resulting level will be 1
00068  */
00069 void
00070 SyncTreeWorkerInit(struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *head,
00071                    struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ent);
00072 
00073 /**
00074  * requires that the node be present
00075  * @returns the SyncNodeElem from the current position
00076  * @returns NULL if not valid
00077  */
00078 struct SyncNodeElem *
00079 SyncTreeWorkerGetElem(struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *head);
00080 
00081 /**
00082  * @returns the entry at the top of the stack
00083  * @returns NULL if no valid current entry
00084  */
00085 struct SyncTreeWorkerEntry *
00086 SyncTreeWorkerTop(struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *head);
00087 
00088 /**
00089  * pushes into the node at the current position
00090  * @returns the cache entry for the child (if any)
00091  * pushing where there is no node has no effect and returns NULL
00092  */
00093 struct SyncTreeWorkerEntry *
00094 SyncTreeWorkerPush(struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *head);
00095 
00096 /**
00097  * pops the stack and returns the top entry
00098  * popping an empty stack has no effect and returns NULL
00099  */
00100 struct SyncTreeWorkerEntry *
00101 SyncTreeWorkerPop(struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *head);
00102 
00103 /**
00104  * Reset the worker to the given level (or the current level if that is less).
00105  * Resets the position at the new level to 0.
00106  */
00107 void
00108 SyncTreeWorkerReset(struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *head, int level);
00109 
00110 /**
00111  * Free the storage for the worker.
00112  * @returns NULL.
00113  */
00114 struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *
00115 SyncTreeWorkerFree(struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *head);
00116 
00117 /**
00118  * Lookup the name in the tree, starting at the current point,
00119  * with backtrack while the level is greater than the given minimum.
00120  * The lookup can be restarted when a missing node is encountered.
00121  * When SCR_missing is returned, SyncTreeWorkerTop(head) is missing.
00122  */
00123 enum SyncCompareResult
00124 SyncTreeLookupName(struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *head,
00125                    struct ccn_charbuf *name,
00126                    int minLevel);
00127 
00128 /**
00129  * Generate the names in the tree, starting at the current point,
00130  * with backtrack while the level is greater than the given minimum.
00131  * When SCR_missing is returned, SyncTreeWorkerTop(head) is missing.
00132  */
00133 enum SyncCompareResult
00134 SyncTreeGenerateNames(struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *head,
00135                       struct SyncNameAccum *accum,
00136                       int minLevel);
00137 
00138 /**
00139  * Mark all reachable cache entries using the current tree worker head,
00140  * with backtrack while the level is greater than the given minimum.
00141  * When SCR_missing is returned, SyncTreeWorkerTop(head) is missing.
00142  * @returns the number of marked nodes.
00143  */
00144 int
00145 SyncTreeMarkReachable(struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *head, int minLevel);
00146 
00147 
00148 #endif
